intro: Morisonia crotonoides, commonly known as the redroot morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its striking red roots and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces trumpet-shaped, violet to purple flowers that bloom in the morning. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Morisonia crotonoides is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar climbing or trailing growth habits.
